Posts.Content: Nov 24, 2012 07:59PM Terryberry23 wrote: Camilla I think it is very normal to let our minds go to the dark place after treatments. We want to feel good again and we don't want to wait. I know everyone kept telling me give it time. I know at 4 weeks I still was having leg pain and not feeling energy wise up to par. Every day you will get stronger and less pain. Just don't overdo and try not to get discouraged.
Posts.Title: 4 weeks post Chemo... what is normal? Camillia ruthbru

Posts.Content: Apr 17, 2012 09:33AM Terryberry23 wrote: I wanted to scream at my oncologist at my last appointment for Heceptin.  She made the comment it was nice to see the old me was back with my painted nails and cute clothes.  She said she had been really worried about me.  I wanted to say REALLY????!!!!!! Me too.  When I kept telling you I wasnt eating because nothing tasted good or wasn't able to sleep you all just seemed like it was no big deal.  Thank Goodness I didn't do something drastic while I wasnt myself and yeah you are right I wasnt my nails fell apart and I couldnt paint them and yeah I had no hair and the reason I wasnt wearing my cute clothes was they didnt fit anymore thanks to chemo and plus I needed my sweats and sweatshirts because I was freezing and still am.  I plan on saying something when I go back next as it was then I was just ready to get the last treatment on the road but would have been nice to have know back then she was worried and heard some good advice from her.
Posts.Title: What does/did your MO/RO/BS/PS say that made you want to scream? Momof2inME Wordwrangler
